title: Don't Show Enemies I Have Hextech Flash
body: Currently, if the enemy team isn't lazy, they can tab and see if I have Flash up by checking whether I have the blue Hextech Flash instead. I think this is way too much information and makes this rune super unattractive regardless of potential merits. I think displaying this information just for allies makes way more sense.

replies.body: The enemy team still needs to know you have Hextech Flash as a rune. I think the proper way to do this is simply to have it displayed instead of the Flash image as half Flash and half Hextech. This way, they understand what rune you have but they don't get free information.

Why do they need to know though? It doesn't show anything for many other minor runes, suddenly they need to have this information for some reason?
I'm not even using hextech flash, but I don't get why would they need to have that information.

Actually, your tower will show the little diamonds beside it if someone on the enemy team has Demolish. Likewise, you can always tell if someone has Slightly Magical Boots by looking at their boots. 
Knowing you have Hextech Flash changes the way people play. Knowing if your enemy's flash is up or not changes what you'll do in that situation. If it displays you have Hexflash up, then they know you won't be able to just flash away if you dive them.

>Actually, your tower will show the little diamonds beside it if someone on the enemy team has Demolish.

Yeah, I know.

>Likewise, you can always tell if someone has Slightly Magical Boots by looking at their boots.

But you can't tell if someone has slightly magical boots before they get it and that's when this information would ACTUALLY matter.

>Knowing if your enemy's flash is up or not changes what you'll do in that situation. If it displays you have Hexflash up, then they know you won't be able to just flash away if you dive them.

I'm not sure why you're thinking I need explanation on that particular part <.<
Maybe I'd misunderstood your post... XD Apologies, I thought you meant that no other minor runes did that, so I was offering examples.
Most of them aren't though :D

Manaflow band shows in the color of mana bar and a blue glow around your champ's 'hands'. The MR/Armor runs show a circle underneath you when you activate their hardiness. They added a graphic to gathering storm that shows when you hit a new bonus point. Almost every minor rune that has a timer/activation/limited availability has notifications. I don't know where you got the idea they don't.

Most of them don't, I don't know where you got the idea that they do.
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/vX6yXijB-dont-show-enemies-i-have-hextech-flash?comment=0003000000000000

I said the ones that have state changes do. Not all minor runes, but ones that change states based on time/stacks/what-have-you do. Ultimate Hat might be an exception? The Legend stacks have a visual indicator each time you get one, biscuit delivery you can see in their inventory bar. Things that are always on tend not to. Nullifying Orb I actually don't know. It might be on the buff bar? It should if it doesn't, though hexdrinker doesn't either, so might be something to be implemented in future. I'd say it should.

I thought you were saying there's no reason to show an indicator for hexflash, and I was just pointing at other minor runes that have windows of opportunity that also show your opponent when you have them up, or when they are active. 

I am not saying all minor runes should have an indicator, I was simply showing the precedent present throughout the design. Your post here is a lot of anger at my response and very little data directly addressing my points, and I am more than happy to read whatever you have to say on this.

Ok let's go back to the initial comment. Someone says players need to see when hexflash is up, you seem to suggest that other runes don't show you, or don't need to show you when they're up.

"Why do they need to know though? It doesn't show anything for many other minor runes, suddenly they need to have this information for some reason?" -Purejoyce

my answer to this is the same one I've been saying, in that most other windowed runes have visual indicators that are public. That is the explanation. It remains consistent throughout most of rune's design.

The boots is one such rune that you seemed to suggest is hidden power, and I am asking how you would change how you play based on the knowledge of someone having/not having this rune.

What am I misunderstanding?

Because it's a _lot_ of important information. Something like the free boots doesn't have the potential for a massive impact on the game (its impact is relatively minor, and is significantly smoothed out), but Hexflash, while relatively shitty an option, still has the potential to have a _massive_ impact on the game.

> Because it's a _lot_ of important information. Something like the free boots doesn't have the potential for a massive impact on the game (its impact is relatively minor, and is significantly smoothed out), but Hexflash, while relatively shitty an option, still has the potential to have a _massive_ impact on the game.

But it is a potentially important information in many matchups that they can't get the boots when they want to.

And what about 3rd slot of precision or domination tree? What about ultimate hat? Is there an indicator for nullifying orb? (I actually don't know :p) Biscuit delivery? Future's market?

No it's not, you have zero power over the way your opponent buys, the only potential thing are like counterplay-type items, none of which are locked out by runes. How would you counterplay boots? Or lack of boots?

Yeah, we talked about this one a fair bit internally. I think I've posted something on Hexflash before but the TL;DR is: 

We think a player who chooses the rune should get at least 1 good surprise with it. That's most likely why they picked the rune in the first place. Thus, Hexflash doesn't show until you use it the first time and the Flash icon subs out. 

HOWEVER, we still want it to be fair for enemies to play against, which is why we show it on the scoreboard so an observant enemy can track the change between Flash/Hexflash. 

Will definitely be keeping an eye on this rune to see how it performs, and if we see problems with the level of visibility it has/gets then we may change that paradigm.

Ravenous Hunter is easy to notice. Even with 0 stacks it's still 2.5% spell vamp. If you see your opponent gain a bit of health back whenever they hit with a spell, it's safe to say they have Ravenous Hunter. 

Overheal has a clear visible scheme. Your character gets a white shield aura around them.

My issue with that is that it basically gives away your Flash CD to the enemy. If I'm Amumu Jungle for instance, and I took Hexflash for exotic ganking path, I'll still play very differently in a team-fight depending on whether my True Flash is available or not. And letting my enemies know for free if I have it or not doesn't feel fair.

I'm all for letting the opponents know I have picked the Hexflash Rune. But don't give them info on my True Flash CD for free.
